main_definition: Configurations refer to the various ways in which a system, device or concept can be set up, arranged, organized, or adapted.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Arrangements of physical components and settings within hardware devices
meanings_and_examples.example: The configurations for setting up a computer involve adjusting the BIOS settings, installing operating systems, configuring network settings, etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Possible ways in which software can be set up or structured
meanings_and_examples.example: A word processing application has various configuration options like font style and size, margin settings, paragraph alignment, etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The different variations of data models used to organize information within a database system
meanings_and_examples.example: In a relational database management system (RDBMS), configurations can include setting up tables, defining relationships between them, and establishing constraints on the data.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Various arrangements of elements in a graphical or visual presentation
meanings_and_examples.example: Graphic designers work with different configurations of colors, shapes, fonts, and layouts to create visually appealing designs.
